intro: Leucopogon richei var. parviflorus, commonly known as the small-flowered heath, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and dense foliage. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in spring, typically arranged in clusters. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and is often found in heathlands and open forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
